meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to shitcan these old magazines to make space.
meanings.sent2: After the party, we will shitcan the leftover food.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally shitcanned my broken phone instead of recycling it.
meanings.sent4: She decided to shitcan her toxic relationship and move on.
meanings.sent5: The clutter was overwhelming, so she had to shitcan many items.

meanings.definition: A container used for disposing of waste.
meanings.sent1: The janitor emptied the shitcan in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: Please throw the gum wrapper in the nearest shitcan.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon knocked over the outdoor shitcan looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The park was clean, with a shitcan every few feet.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing shitcan emitted a foul odor.

meanings.definition: A situation or plan that has failed or been abandoned.
meanings.sent1: The project turned out to be a total shitcan.
meanings.sent2: His idea to start a business was a complete shitcan.
meanings.sent3: The party was a shitcan after the power went out.
meanings.sent4: Their vacation plans went down the shitcan due to bad weather.
meanings.sent5: The meeting was a shitcan with no resolution in sight.
